data.title: Ok food- avoid the restroom!
data.text:
This is a chain restaurant with predictable food...consistent,not amazing but certainly adequate. We arrived at lunchtime and they were busy but the sevice was pretty decent and our sandwich was predictably OK.
However...my husband and I each used the restroom and were pretty horrified by the conditions...not just a mess but grungy-dirty.,floors, sinks, receptacles in the stalls, all with layers of yuck..toilet paper not even in the holder so everyone who used it had to handle it..I couldn't dwell too much on the idea of waitstaff washing hands etc. in there then serving...if it had just been messy we would have just brought it to someone's attention for a touchup but this was something that needed serious elbow grease. Chain restaurants usually are predictably reasonably clean but this....wasn't.

data.title: OK place to eat, but wouldn't frequent
data.text: The place is just OK I would say.  The food is so-so.  We have had good food, but we have had problems too.  When they have their coupon specials for discounted meals we sometimes go, but I don't think the place is good enough to go and pay regular prices.  Too many other places to go that are better.

data.title: Great atmosphere and Delicious food.
data.text: This is a very nice place to eat breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Good prices and even better if you get a coupon.

data.title: Always Crowded at Meal Time says something
data.text: Mimi's is Mimi's. They are in every town and they are pretty consistent. This one is pretty good, always crowded at meal times. Mimi's adopted a new and slightly pricier menu a few years back. I miss some of the entrees I used to order. And they are not automatically bringing a nice bread basket as they used to but otherwise, it is still good and has a large menu.

data.title: A little too pricey.
data.text: We both had the Turkey dinner and a couple of sodas and it was $40.00 before the tip. The food was very good as was the service. They charged $3.59 for each soda which is way too much.

data.title: A good place for Sunday Brunch or lunch with friends
data.text:
This is a family restaurant with good, close to home made meals. 
It has a small outdoors dinning area and a bar. It is located in a very busy corner, and some times it is hard to find handicapped parking.

data.title: Always delicious
data.text: I visit Mimi's a few times a year, mostly to meet with friends. The menu gets better every year. The staff is friendly, the prices are reasonable, and the food is plentiful and delicious!

data.title: Good family restaurant
data.text: Great place for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Generous portions, generally fast service and good quality of food. Like the wine selections and prices.

data.title: Mighty Mimi
data.text: After visiting the Nixon Library, we stopped in for lunch at Mimi's. The wait staff quite cordial. I had the chicken salad sandwich and my fiancé the turkey dinner. We enjoyed our food most assuredly. I had a white peach mimosa that tasted divine.

data.title: Average
data.text:
This place has changed owners and menu 
Old menu was way better 
New foods ate just so so 
Would not be my first choice to take someone for dinner

data.title: Excellent short dining experience
data.text: Interesting menu in a relatively small restaurant. Service was very good; prices about what you would expect in Southern California; food selection was above average and the quality was good. For a small meal, such as lunch, this is a good place.

data.title: Excellent service
data.text: My husband and I stopped for a late lunch.  He had mussels and frites; I had the salmon salad both were excellent. We had both Kevins as severs. They were very attentive. We definitely recommend.

data.title: Good breakfast
data.text:
There were 4 of us for breakfast in this chain restaurant. We were seated immediately.
Our drink order was

data.title: A nice French-oriented samll restaurant chain
data.text: This chain recently returned somewhat to its origial roots by bringing back several French-oriented dishes.  It is a fine place to have breakfast, lunch or dinner.

data.title: Always good!
data.text: The french onion soup and pot roast are not to be missed.  Always enjoy Mimi's, this is a chain restaurant, but you won'e feel like it.  Great service.

data.title: Late lunch
data.text:
Used Mimi's digital coupon, only had to show to get the discount. 2 drinks, 1 entries  is free. 

Quickly seated, waiter was attentive and helpful. Our order was served quickly, hot and very good. 

Near the Nixon Presidential Library and Museum with easy street access,.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Mimi's has seemed to cut down on quality. My husband's toast was almost warm bread with a little brown on the edges. The butter was served in a "hospital pill" type container that was very small. His omelet  had little flavor other than the hot sauce. They no longer served the potatoes, onions, and peppers, but just small cooked potatoes. My banana pecan pancakes didn't seem to have any bananas in them. The menu said I got fresh fruit with my "Grande" breakfast, but when I asked about it they said they no longer serve them with the meal!

data.title: Friendly staff, great food
data.text: After visiting the Nixon Library, we went for lunch to Mimi's Cafe. It's nice to find a well-known establishment when you're hungry. There is not a Mimi's near where we live so we were happy to find this one. I love the Corn Chowder and the carrot raisin muffins! I was a bit disappointed that they no longer give the carrot muffins complimentary. They do have a little muffin-ette that you'll receive along with sour dough rolls. The muffin-ette is good, it just isn't as good as the real thing. I think they took the nuts out of these and that alters the flavor.  The staff is very friendly and attentive. You'll enjoy a yummy home-cooked feeling meal here.

data.title: Mimi's Family Friendly Restaurant
data.text: We just had lunch at Mimi's today, taking my daughter and almost 5 year old grandson, who can be a very picky eater.  My daughter ordered soup and sandwich, my grandson ordered chicken fingers and I ordered the chicken salad.  All three of us were delighted with our choices and were served exactly the way we ordered them.  My salad was made with crisp lettuce, shredded carrots, mandarin oranges and yummy shaded chicken with the dressing on the side.  It also came with a yummy muffin.  We were offered drink refills and my daughter and grandson received their drink refills in to go cups.  We all left with full tummys and smiles.  Very fun, inviting restaurant with delicious food choices.

data.title: Check the wine prices!
data.text:
Today I treated three friends to lunch at Mimi's. Each of us ordered a glass of wine. The sign in front said , "Enjoy a glass of wine for five dollars."When  we received our bill we were charged eight dollars per glass. The server said they changed  their policy about one month ago about all wine being  five dollars. Seems to me they should inform you about that before you order. She apologized and said she had received numerous complaints.

I called Jason, the manager. He apologized and said he would check it out.
When I spoke to his supervisor, Mike, he said he was unfamiliar with the sign and would check it out. I doubt very much that this will happen.

I'm disappointed that Mimi's seems to be deliberately misleading their customers.
